millions building cathedrals to connect communities to God. But as debts and poverty skyrocket, many are questioning the price tag. - [Low cost supermarket opens in Broken Hill to ease the cost-of-living burden for struggling families](https://www.newslocker.com/en-au/news/economic-news-australia/low-cost-supermarket-opens-in-broken-hill-to-ease-the-cost-of-living-burden-for-struggling-families/view/)Established by a social housing provider, the Pantry aims to assist those from lower socio-economic backgrounds in particular. - [Taylor Swift's The Tortured Poets Department is nearly here, but it could be a logistical nightmare for the Eras Tour](https://www.newslocker.com/en-au/news/economic-news-australia/taylor-swifts-the-tortured-poets-department-is-nearly-here-but-it-could-be-a-logistical-nightmare-for-the-eras-tour/view/)The Tortured Poets Department could very well break streaming records, but it also poses a headache for Taylor Swift's Eras Tour. How do you include another album into a show that's already over three hours long? - [Faith with a price tag: How much should people pay to connect to God?](https://www.newslocker.com/en-au/news/economic-news-australia/faith-with-a-price-tag-how-much-should-people-pay-to-connect-to-god/view/)In Samoa, churches spend millions building cathedrals to connect communities to God. But as debts and poverty skyrocket, many are questioning the price tag. - [King Island desperate to ship cattle to Victoria as drought takes hold](https://www.newslocker.com/en-au/news/economic-news-australia/king-island-desperate-to-ship-cattle-to-victoria-as-drought-takes-hold/view/)It is normally lush and green, but King Island is drought-stricken and its farmers are calling for help to ship their cattle and sheep north to the mainland. - [Drought puts squeeze on King Island farmers as Tasmanian government considers shipping to mainland](https://www.newslocker.com/en-au/news/economic-news-australia/drought-puts-squeeze-on-king-island-farmers-as-tasmanian-government-considers-shipping-to-mainland/view/)It is normally lush and green, but King Island is drought-stricken and its farmers are desperate to ship cattle north to Victoria. - [Drought puts squeeze on King Island farmers as Tasmanian government considers more shipping options](https://www.newslocker.com/en-au/news/economic-news-australia/drought-puts-squeeze-on-king-island-farmers-as-tasmanian-government-considers-more-shipping-options/view/)It is normally lush and green, but King Island is drought-stricken and its farmers are desperate to ship cattle north to Victoria. - [Mammoth federal green scheme risks 'zombie projects' that never get built, analyst warns](https://www.newslocker.com/en-au/news/economic-news-australia/mammoth-federal-green-scheme-risks-zombie-projects-that-never-get-built-analyst-warns/view/)The federal government plans to spend tens of billions of dollars building new green energy projects. An analyst is warning against "zombie projects" that go nowhere. - [Seven West Media CEO James Warburton steps down](https://www.newslocker.com/en-au/news/economic-news-australia/seven-west-media-ceo-james-warburton-steps-down/view/)Seven West Media chief executive and managing director James Warburton steps down with immediate effect. - [James Warburton steps down as Seven West Media CEO with immediate effect](https://www.newslocker.com/en-au/news/economic-news-australia/james-warburton-steps-down-as-seven-west-media-ceo-with-immediate-effect/view/)Seven West Media chief executive and managing director James Warburton steps down with immediate effect. - [Powercor pleads guilty to 104 charges including failing to inspect powerlines and cut vegetation, leading to bushfire](https://www.newslocker.com/en-au/news/economic-news-australia/powercor-pleads-guilty-to-104-charges-including-failing-to-inspect-powerlines-and-cut-vegetation-leading-to-bushfire/view/)The electricity distribution Today in the Shepparton Magistrates Court electricity distribution company Powercor admitted to failing to cut back vegetation around its powerlines, triggering a risk management failure that resulted in a bushfire in western Victoria. - [Outback newspaper the Barrier Truth announces closure after nearly 130 years](https://www.newslocker.com/en-au/news/economic-news-australia/outback-newspaper-the-barrier-truth-announces-closure-after-nearly-130-years/view/)The union-run newspaper's shutdown is another blow to the Far West New South Wales town of Broken Hill, which lost its nightly commercial news bulletin a year ago. - [Woolworths admits to underpaying staff $1.24m](https://www.newslocker.com/en-au/news/economic-news-australia/woolworths-admits-to-underpaying-staff-124m/view/)Today Woolworths admitted in court that it short-changed at least 1,235 former Victorian employees by not properly paying their long service leave entitlements. - ['It will not go ahead': Company withdraws bid to develop protected wetlands after environment minister's interim refusal](https://www.newslocker.com/en-au/news/economic-news-australia/it-will-not-go-ahead-company-withdraws-bid-to-develop-protected-wetlands-after-environment-ministers-interim-refusal/view/)Earlier this month Tanya Plibersek released an interim decision that found removing 58.7 hectares from the internationally protected wetland was an "unacceptable impact". - [Company behind $1.4b Toondah Harbour development withdraws application](https://www.newslocker.com/en-au/news/economic-news-australia/company-behind-14b-toondah-harbour-development-withdraws-application/view/)Earlier this month Tanya Plibersek released an interim decision that found removing 58.7 hectares from the internationally protected wetland was an "unacceptable impact". - [Despite the world's need for more food, farmers could be forced to grow fewer crops this year](https://www.newslocker.com/en-au/news/economic-news-australia/despite-the-worlds-need-for-more-food-farmers-could-be-forced-to-grow-fewer-crops-this-year/view/)While shoppers battle with the cost of food at the check-out, farmers around the world are expected to sow less crops this year, as the cost of growing some produce is higher than its potential value. - [Unemployment has gone up, but Corbin is finding it hard to keep staff long-term](https://www.newslocker.com/en-au/news/economic-news-australia/unemployment-has-gone-up-but-corbin-is-finding-it-hard-to-keep-staff-long-term/view/)The unemployment rate increased slightly to 3.8 per cent in March, after employment fell by 7,000 people and unemployment rose by 21,000 people. - [It's getting a bit harder to find a job, but the labour market remains 'incredibly tight'](https://www.newslocker.com/en-au/news/economic-news-australia/its-getting-a-bit-harder-to-find-a-job-but-the-labour-market-remains-incredibly-tight/view/)The unemployment rate increased slightly to 3.8 per cent in March, after employment fell by 7,000 people and unemployment rose by 21,000 people. - [Prince Harry may have to settle Murdoch lawsuit after Hugh Grant deal, his lawyer says](https://www.newslocker.com/en-au/news/economic-news-australia/prince-harry-may-have-to-settle-murdoch-lawsuit-after-hugh-grant-deal-his-lawyer-says/view/)Prince Harry's lawyer says he may be "forced" to settle a lawsuit against the publisher of Rupert Murdoch's tabloid newspaper The Sun after British actor Hugh Grant agreed on a deal. - [Live: Wall St posts fourth day of losses as investors weigh higher-for-longer rate risks](https://www.newslocker.com/en-au/news/economic-news-australia/live-wall-st-posts-fourth-day-of-losses-as-investors-weigh-higher-for-longer-rate-risks/view/)The benchmark US share index posted its fourth straight day of losses taking it 4 per cent off its recent record high, although gains in iron ore are expected to push the ASX higher. Follow the latest on our live markets blog. - [Live: Local share market opens higher ahead of jobs data, BHP to decide Nickel West's future by August](https://www.newslocker.com/en-au/news/economic-news-australia/live-local-share-market-opens-higher-ahead-of-jobs-data-bhp-to-decide-nickel-wests-future-by-august/view/)The ASX is trading higher after gains in iron ore as investors await the latest jobs data from the ABS. It comes after the benchmark US share index posted its fourth straight day of losses. It comes after the benchmark US share index posted its fourth straight day of losses. It comes after the benchmark US share index posted its fourth straight day of losses. Follow the latest on our live markets blog. - [ASX snaps five-day losing streak to end 0.5pc higher, BHP to decide Nickel West's future by August — as it happened](https://www.newslocker.com/en-au/news/economic-news-australia/asx-snaps-five-day-losing-streak-to-end-05pc-higher-bhp-to-decide-nickel-wests-future-by-august-mdash-as-it-happened/view/)The ASX has snapped a five-day losing streak to close 0.5 per cent higher on Thursday, while the unemployment rate rose to 3.8 per cent in March. Look back on the day's developments as they happened with our blog. - [Queensland's go card to be scrapped, replaced with new public transport fare pass](https://www.newslocker.com/en-au/news/economic-news-australia/queenslands-go-card-to-be-scrapped-replaced-with-new-public-transport-fare-pass/view/)The cards used by public transport commuters in South East Queensland for well over a decade will be phased out and replaced with a new fare card system — but Translink is yet to determine when. - [A restaurant visit can be 'stressful' for people with disabilities — but app Pavely is helping pave the way for change](https://www.newslocker.com/en-au/news/economic-news-australia/a-restaurant-visit-can-be-stressful-for-people-with-disabilities-mdash-but-app-pavely-is-helping-pave-the-way-for-change/view/)For many people living with disability, catching up with friends for a coffee or a night out often involves a level of extra planning – but an app is making crucial information about whether a venue or activity is accessible much more readily available. - [Shortage of health professionals sees another Queensland maternity ward announce its closure](https://www.newslocker.com/en-au/news/economic-news-australia/shortage-of-health-professionals-sees-another-queensland-maternity-ward-announce-its-closure/view/)Another private hospital is poised to shut down maternity services in Queensland, as new data shows a significant shift away from private births. - [Another birthing ward to shut amid 'maternity crisis'](https://www.newslocker.com/en-au/news/economic-news-australia/another-birthing-ward-to-shut-amid-maternity-crisis/view/)Another private hospital is poised to shut down maternity services in Queensland, as new data shows a significant shift away from private births.
